niagara.connection_server
Class ConnectionManager

java.lang.Object
  niagara.connection_server.ConnectionManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class ConnectionManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

The ConnectionManager listens on a well known port for connection requests. When a connection is requested, the connection manager Creates a new connection and a new socket. This new socket will receive all subsequent messages sent over that connection.

Constructor Summary
ConnectionManager(int queryEngineWellKnownPort, NiagraServer server)
          server is passed because it is used for getting access to dataManager and queryQueues
 
Method Summary
 void run()
          This is the run method invoked by the Java thread - it simply waits on a socket for client connection messages
 void shutdown()
          Shut the connection manager down gracefully
